intro: Descurainia lasisiliqua, commonly known as the desert mustard, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and compound leaves that are adapted to conserve water. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard species. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited to harsh desert environments. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
